arts.ttl: Crystal Palace vs Brentford – Predicted lineup and team news
arts.sum: Crystal Palace return to Selhurst Park today, still buzzing from one of their great cup victories. Indeed, the Eagles put in a stunning performance on Wednesday, beating Liverpool 3-0 at Anfield in the Carabao Cup. Now, manager Oliver Glasner will demand that same level of performance back in the league. The team’s home form has […] The post Crystal Palace vs Brentford – Predicted lineup and team news first appeared on The Football Faithful.

arts.ttl: Brentford XI vs Crystal Palace – Predicted lineup and team news
arts.sum: Brentford travel to Selhurst Park on Saturday in superb form, aiming for a third consecutive Premier League victory. This confidence comes after impressive recent wins against Manchester United (3-1) and league champions Liverpool (3-2). Furthermore, they are going to the match after a morale-boosting 5-0 win in the Carabao Cup midweek. arts.ttl: Oliver Glasner is ‘impressed’ with the evolution of Brentford
arts.sum: “Of course, I watched their last game against Liverpool because these were our next two opponents. Also, now when they play Kristoffer Ajer as a left-back, that means many tall players, and then getting the game into the final third, of course, long throw-ins, set plays.

arts.ttl: Keith Andrews enjoying life at Brentford as Bees seek fourth consecutive win away to Crystal Palace
arts.sum: "During the week is a good example of that: you go from playing Liverpool, playing the way we did, to then going to face League Two opposition in the Cup, and I think that’s a real good test of where we’re at as a football club." Keith Andrews says he is "enjoying" life as Brentford head coach as his side seek a fourth consecutive win under him when they travel to Crystal Palace on Saturday afternoon.

arts.ttl: Brentford receive triple fitness boost ahead of Palace away trip
